newsitem.title: UK: UK's FTSE 100 ends firm, helped by weak sterling.
newsitem.headline: UK's FTSE 100 ends firm, helped by weak sterling.

text.p: Britain's FTSE 100 leading share index finished moderately higher on Monday, bolstered by strength in the large multinational companies that benefited from the vicious sell-off in sterling, traders and analysts said.
But investors were still cautious ahead of a line-up of UK corporate results and U.S. economic data due out this week.
The FTSE 100 rose 11.1 points to 4,862.6 but decliners led advancers by a 53 to 40 margin.
The broader FTSE 250 fell 13.5 points to 4,461.2.
"What happened today is sterling's weakness," said Ian Williams, UK equities strategist at Panmure Gordon.
